snippet: Francis told bishops that the church must stay true to its teachings on the “indissolubility” of marriage, while also calling on them to be sensitive to the complexity of modern society.
abstract: Pope Francis opens Vatican synod on family issues with exhortation to gathered bishops that they must be sensitive to modern society and its complexity and should not stand in judgment of it.
lead_paragraph: Francis told bishops that the church must stay true to its teachings on the “indissolubility” of marriage, while also calling on them to be sensitive to the complexity of modern society.
